N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1500.7 - Instruction and identification of new and existing systems

State Regulations
(a) Adequate printed instructions relative to
their purpose and use shall be posted in a conspicuous manner at fire alarm
boxes and at control boards. (b) Fire alarm boxes shall be identified and shall have a conspicuous exterior
color. (c) There shall be
permanently mounted at right angles to the wall a durable sign at least eight
inches square with conspicuous letters reading, FIRE ALARM BOX. Such sign shall
be located above every fire alarm box, and approximately seven feet above the
floor. Notes
